intro: Acyntha patens, commonly known as the spreading acynthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Acyntha patens is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
